snippet: It’s hard to be a smart shopper for prescriptions, or any kind of health care.
abstract: News analysis; dysfunctional federal Web site for the health insurance exchanges has masked the more fundamental question of whether Americans are capable of shopping effectively for health care; most developed countries do not even ask their citizens to be smart health care consumers; opacity in pricing of drugs offers an example of how the system is set up to make it hard for consumers to get a good deal.
lead_paragraph: It’s hard to be a smart shopper for prescriptions, or any kind of health care.

headline.main: Good Deals on Pills? It’s Anyone’s Guess
headline.print_headline: Good Deals on Pills? It’s Anyone’s Guess

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
